channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Ukrainian military chaplain shares wisdom from the frontlines
item.description: Father Andriy Zelinskyy, a chaplain in wartime Ukraine, talks about what he sees in the trenches and what he's learned about the fragility of humanity, years into the war with Russia.
item.content:encoded: Father Andriy Zelinskyy, a chaplain in wartime Ukraine, talks about what he sees in the trenches and what he's learned about the fragility of humanity, years into the war with Russia.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ofman

item.title: Milan pushes back against the prime minister's immigration policies
item.description: In Milan, the site of the Winter Olympic Games, the mayor is taking steps to help migrants while the national governments seeks to discourage immigration.
item.content:encoded: In Milan, the site of the Winter Olympic Games, the mayor is taking steps to help migrants while the national governments seeks to discourage immigration.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: 'I stayed in this room for over a year and a half,' former inmate at Syria's Sednaya prison returns
item.description: An inmate who was imprisoned for 21 years in Syria's notorious Sadnaya prison shows NPR's Jane Arraf the concrete cells where he was held.
item.content:encoded: An inmate who was imprisoned for 21 years in Syria's notorious Sadnaya prison shows NPR's Jane Arraf the concrete cells where he was held.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Mexican army kills leader of Jalisco New Generation Cartel, official says
item.description: The Mexican army killed the leader of the powerful Jalisco New Generation Cartel, Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, "El Mencho," in an operation Sunday, a federal official said.
item.content:encoded:
The Mexican army killed the leader of the powerful Jalisco New Generation Cartel, Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, "El Mencho," in an operation Sunday, a federal official said.

(Image credit: Alejandra Leyva/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Ukraine's combat amputees cling to hope as a weapon of war
item.description: Along with a growing number of war-wounded amputees, Mykhailo Varvarych and Iryna Botvynska are navigating an altered destiny after Varvarych lost both his legs during the Russian invasion.
item.content:encoded:
Along with a growing number of war-wounded amputees, Mykhailo Varvarych and Iryna Botvynska are navigating an altered destiny after Varvarych lost both his legs during the Russian invasion.

(Image credit: Carol Guzy for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Carol Guzy

item.title: University students hold new protests in Iran around memorials for those killed
item.description: Iran's state news agency said students protested at five universities in the capital, Tehran, and one in the city of Mashhad on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
Iran's state news agency said students protested at five universities in the capital, Tehran, and one in the city of Mashhad on Sunday.

(Image credit: Vahid Salemi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Pakistan claims to have killed at least 70 militants in strikes along Afghan border
item.description: Pakistan's military killed at least 70 militants in strikes along the border with Afghanistan early Sunday, the deputy interior minister said.
item.content:encoded:
Pakistan's military killed at least 70 militants in strikes along the border with Afghanistan early Sunday, the deputy interior minister said.

(Image credit: Hedayat Shah)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Danish military evacuates U.S. submariner who needed urgent medical care off Greenland
item.description: Denmark's military says its arctic command forces evacuated a crew member of a U.S. submarine off the coast of Greenland for urgent medical treatment.
item.content:encoded:
Denmark's military says its arctic command forces evacuated a crew member of a U.S. submarine off the coast of Greenland for urgent medical treatment.

(Image credit: Bo Amstrup)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Europe reacts to new tariffs announcement and more uncertainty
item.description: President Trump announced a 15% increase on tariffs across the board. Europeans have been celebrating yesterday's SCOTUS decision, but have been doing so quietly.
item.content:encoded: President Trump announced a 15% increase on tariffs across the board. Europeans have been celebrating yesterday's SCOTUS decision, but have been doing so quietly.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Jubilation in Lahore with return of historic kite festival
item.description: The Pakistani city of Lahore celebrated the revival of a historic kite festival called Basant last weekend, 19 years after kite flying there was deemed too dangerous and banned.
item.content:encoded: The Pakistani city of Lahore celebrated the revival of a historic kite festival called Basant last weekend, 19 years after kite flying there was deemed too dangerous and banned.
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles
